Evaluation GridÔÉÅ

We solve a system of SDE in the time window \([t_{start},t_{end}]\). At the initial time point \(t=t_{start}\), the state vector \(\vec{S(t_{start})}\) is known (it is the input). When computations will reach \(t=t_{end}\), the solution \(\vec{S(t_{end})}\) is available.

For some problems it is suffice to have \(\vec{S(t_{end})}\) as the result of a computation. For some other problems, you may want to observe the intermediate states \(\vec{S(\tau)}\), \(t_{start} < \tau < t_{end}\). It is very unpractical to return the list of \(\vec{S(t_i)}\), where \(i={1\cdots k}\) is every point of the time grid.

User needs to provide the list of evaluation points explicitly.
